alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northwest Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 19 at 8:48PM MDT until April 20 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU, NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Strong southwest and west winds will resume by midmorning Wednesday after widespread poor overnight humidity recoveries. About 5 to 10 hours of single digit humidities are likely across the lower elevations on Wednesday. This will set the stage for another round of critical conditions as temperatures warm 5 to 15 degrees above normal. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands, Northwest Highlands, Middle Rio Grande Valley, Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains, West Central Highlands and the East Central Plains. Critical conditions are expected to develop by midmorning Wednesday and persist through sunset Wednesday evening before diminishing. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 5 to 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended..
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northwest Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
